pr_title: Set warmup duration based on zone

timeline.message:
Set warmup duration based on zone

No warmup time necessary in cd or test environments. Set
default warmup time to 89 seconds, as the previous value of 60
seconds (which ended up being ~90 seconds) was the wanted one based
on experience with prod applications.

timeline.author: freva

timeline.bodyText:
Duration of zero still starts the container unconstrained, but then immediately attempts to suspend against orch. to set limits. Negative will start the container with the constraints 
  
    
      vespa/node-admin/src/main/java/com/yahoo/vespa/hosted/node/admin/nodeagent/NodeAgentImpl.java
    
    
         Line 215
      in
      44e2be1
    
    
    
    

        
          
           ContainerResources wantedResources = context.nodeType() != NodeType.tenant || warmUpDuration.isNegative() ? 
        
    
  



  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            ? Duration.ZERO
          
          
            
                            ? Duration.ofSeconds(-1)
timeline.author: freva

timeline.bodyText: Consider just resolving this when needed via the ZoneApi in NodeAgentContext
timeline.author: freva

replies.bodyText: NodeAgentContextSupplier.nextContext() says blocks until the next context is readyand that sounded like something I wouldn't do in a constructor, I think I'll leave this for now at least
replies.author: hmusum

replies.bodyText:
No, I meant in the methods that actually use this variable (startContainer(), updateContainerIfNeeded() and doConverge()).
Another option is to pass the initial context to the constructor instead of just the zone, since NodeAgentFactory already has it 
  
    
      vespa/node-admin/src/main/java/com/yahoo/vespa/hosted/node/admin/nodeagent/NodeAgentFactory.java
    
    
         Line 9
      in
      44e2be1
    
    
    
    

        
          
           NodeAgent create(NodeAgentContextSupplier contextSupplier, NodeAgentContext nodeAgentContext);
replies.author: freva

replies.bodyText: Yes, I initially did resolving when needed, let's go back to it. Thanks, done
replies.author: hmusum

timeline.message: Use zone from context and resolve warmup time in method instead
